name: Raphanus
Relationship: Compare: MOMORDICA (worse, near splenic flexure); CARBO; ANAC.; ARG. NIT.; BRASSICA.

Head: Oedema of lower eyelids
Headache, brain feels tender and sore
Mucus in posterior nares
Sadness, aversion to children, especially girls
Stomach: Burning in epigastrium, followed by hot eructation
Abdomen: Stool liquid, frothy, profuse, brown, with colic, and pad-like swelling of intestines
NO FLATUS EMITTED UPWARD OR DOWNWARD
Retching and vomiting, loss of appetite
Chest: Heavy lump and coldness in center of chest
Pain in chest extends to back and to throat
Female: Urine more copious, thick like milk
NYMPHOMANIA, with aversion to her own sex and to children, and sexual insomnia
Throat: Hot-ball feeling from uterus to throat, stopping there

details: Produces pain and stitches in liver and spleen. Increases of bile and salivary secretion. Symptoms will not appear if salt is used with the Radish. Great accumulation and incarceration of flatulence. Globus symptoms. Seborrhoea, with greasy skin. Pemphigus. Hysteria; chilliness in back and arms. Sexual insomnia. (KALI-BROM.) Nymphomania. POST-OPERATIVE GAS PAINS.
